meanings.definition: The divine nature or essence of a god.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of the godheads as beings of immense power.
meanings.sent2: The temple was adorned with statues of various godheads.
meanings.sent3: The children played pretend, each claiming to be the godheads of their own imaginary world.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of fantasy, the dragon was considered one of the godheads of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The ancient texts described the godheads as eternal and all-knowing beings.

meanings.sent1: The villagers prayed to the godheads for a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent2: The pantheon consisted of many different godheads, each with their own domain.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child claimed to have seen the godheads playing hide and seek in the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The godheads of old were said to walk among mortals in disguise.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins were said to be the resting place of forgotten godheads.

meanings.definition: The state of being a god.
meanings.sent1: The ascension to godheads was a long and arduous journey for the mortal.
meanings.sent2: In the myths, heroes often sought to attain godheads through great feats.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about achieving godheads through mastering the art of dad jokes.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes captured the essence of godheads in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The philosopher pondered the implications of mortal beings reaching godheads status.
